description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Jazz Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Jazz Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Jazz Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I never thought I would love a double sleeping bag as much as I love the Jazz! It kept us incredibly warm even at 20degrees and was VERY comfortable. We both felt we had plenty of room and was just as comfortable as being at home!
review.name: LOVE THIS SLEEPING BAG!

review.reviewBody: This sleeping bag is awesome!! Silky, soft and cool material inside, with removable sheet that you can snap into place to ensure your partner doesn't steal it during the night but can easily remove for washing. This is the best camping thing ever!!
review.name: Best Thing Evah!!!

review.reviewBody: Material is so comfortable. Love the pocket for the Roamer. I love this bag so much, but the colors are making me want to abandon it. Bring back the nice grey you had  with the old  car camping sleeping bag. It was really.nice
review.name: Great sleeping bag, hideous colors
comment: Thanks for leaving a review! Sorry to hear that the color way is not to your liking but happy to hear that the Jazz seems to be working out for you otherwise. We'll be sure to share your feedback with the product team. Thanks again!

review.reviewBody: Love how the bag has wide sleeves on the bottom of the bag to slide over the roamer air mattress. The bag does not slide off at all. it is great.  30 F temp rating is perfect for the type of camping we do.
review.name: Jazz Sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: Overall the design of this bag is ideal for side sleepers, and thats why I bought it.  It also has a sleeve on the back for the sleeping pad, which I appreciate.  Unfortunately, the zippers get stuck on the bag constantly and two years into owning this bag both of them are nonfunctional rendering the bag insufficient for staying warm.  The sheet that clips into the bag will never stay in place.  I have tried literally every camping trip, it is ripped off with the slightest movement.  Please consider these notes in the next iteration of your design of this bag.
review.name: Zipper failure, clip on sheet worthless
comment: We appreciate your honest feedback regarding your recent experience with our product. It's through valuable feedback like yours that we can identify areas for improvement and enhance our offerings. If you have specific questions you want to discuss, please reach out to our customer support team.

name: Jazz Sleeping Bag: 30F Synthetic

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: Used this liner with my sea to summit 0 degree bag. I really liked the texture and feel of the material. Very soft, but not that awful microfiber stuff. I dont see it adding a lot of warmth. It got down to 30 degrees when I used this. I could not tell much of a difference when I took it out of the sleeping bag. It did a good job keeping my bag clean. It packs larger than I thought it would. That would be the only thing negative. It still packs down small.
review.name: Great liner!

review.itemreviewed: Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Looks good, haven't needed it yet. Might be good for really warm nights by itself. Packs light and small.
review.name: Probably good

review.itemreviewed: Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used for foreign travel. Perfect size. Took up minimal space in luggage & did not add to weight! Easy care!
review.name: Great find!

review.itemreviewed: Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used this for a 2-night hut-to-hut ski adventure in Oregon. This liner was lightweight, compact, and snuggly soft. It felt great, launders well and is a super economical option for keeping a layer between me and the sleeping bag.
review.name: Economical and HIGHLY functional

review.itemreviewed: Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super soft and light weight definitely recommend having a couple for any travel adventures.
review.name: Perfect for travel

review.itemreviewed: Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Recently got a double sleeping bag and thought a liner would be a great addition! Fabric is so soft and comfortable and on some of the warmer eves in the desert it's all you need. Such a treat to be able to snuggle with my person, and have enough space to move around too!
review.name: Snuggles for days!

review.itemreviewed: Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I loved this. It's lightweight and super soft and cozy for two people, or extra luxurious for one! It's now also my go to summer sleeping bag in warm climates (Utah, Texas, even New York etc.). Whish the bag it packs in was a bittt bigger and easy to pack in, so I'd give that a 3 star, but the product itself is definitely 5.
review.name: Great Product - Super summer sleeping bag

review.itemreviewed: Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Was under the impression that this liner would be sewn at the bottom and part way up the sides, it is not, It's a sack, sewn bottom and all the way up the sides. We cut down the sides to within 12" of the bottom to make this work for us. So far the material has not unraveled,
review.name: Was under the impression that

review.itemreviewed: Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent product! Used on a 17 day trip on the remote islands of Fiji, not steamy nights kept me cool while keeping the roaches, rats, mosquitoes and sand flies off me at night! Worth every penny.
review.name: Excellent sleep sack for hot tropical nights

review.itemreviewed: Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: The material of the expander travel liner is soft and comfortable, like a nice sheet. It is so stretchy, however, that it gets twisted around me when I sleep. It almost looks like it has been sewn a little crooked, but I think that is just the material. My biggest complaint is that the extra material for the pillow is not big enough to cover a standard size pillow. I dont know if that is normal for sleeping bag liners but that doesnt make sense to me, since it makes it non-functional as a cover for a pillow.
review.name: Soft but pillow case is too short

name: Premium Stretch Knit Expander Sleeping Bag Liner

review.reviewBody: The material is so solid and feels like great quality cotton. It's a "boxier" fit, so if you like a more relaxed fit I would size up. I got a large and roll the sleeves up a bit so I don't look to much like the shape of a fridge haha! Adorable illustrations and perfect for climbing :)
review.name: Sturdy Tee

review.reviewBody: I was pleasently suprised to find that the materials in this shirt were nice and durable. I bought two of these shirts and different color.
review.name: Really good fabric

review.reviewBody: Not the best cut for busty women. It?s def a slightly fitted shirt, so it may seem smaller than your other workout shirts, but that?s because of the cut. Very thick organic cotton. I wish it had a little more room for busty gals, especially because I bought the XL specifically for the bust.
review.name: Interesting cut

review.reviewBody: Super cute casual shirt! The material is thick/high quality and really like the slightly cropped and boxy look of it. Wore it so often I bought the long sleeve version too!
review.name: Cute casual shirt

review.reviewBody:
I I'm in love with mountain hardwear 
This shirts are so beautiful and comfortable,  I buy it a second one in different color
review.name: 100 recommend

review.reviewBody: Got a small for a more "loose t-shirt" fit rather than a tighter fit. It looks great. The material isn't quite like normal t-shirt material, it feels sturdier.
review.name: V cute and fun

review.reviewBody: I really love the shirt's design and color combo, but it fits strange. It kind of seems like it should be a crop top, but its too long. Its really boxy, but I'm enjoying it. It'll be a fun shirt to go to the gym in!

review.name: Fun boxy tshirt!

hasVariant.name: Capilene Midweight Liner Glove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Capilene Midweight Liner Glove online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I use these in a Hestra 3 finger mitt. Theyre simple and function perfectly when I need to remove my mitts and tinker with a phone, crampons or anything requiring extra dexterity.  The strap at the heel is very useful.  Unfortunately, because they are sheer by design, they are not intended for, nor do I expect they will withstand, prolonged use as a stand-alone, light outer glove.  I have used them in that capacity when Ive peeled off my mitts, and just from the contact with ski poles, are showing signs of wear.
review.name: Functional but delicate

review.reviewBody: Less than a year and only wearing them a handful of times the gloves are tearing at the wrist seam.
review.name: Poor Quality

review.reviewBody:
Velcro instantly shreds the liner.  Otherwise would be a perfect.  

Also, returns to backcountry costing $7 is a little ridiculous for defective items.  Should be free for this type of return.
review.name: Velcro is kryptonite

review.reviewBody: This is a great product for what it is--a thin liner that works underneath a second glove. The thinness is key because thicker liners generally don't work as liners for me. No issue with durability so far, however the material is thin so I can see how it would fall apart under heavy workloads/abuse. True to size for me
review.name: Great for what it is

review.reviewBody: The fingers fit perfectly, but the cuff is too tight with no stretch built in. Gloves developed a hole after wearing 4 times. Returned.
review.name: Holes formed after wearing 4 times

review.reviewBody: When I first tried these on, I loved them. Soft, well constructed and warm. After one day of using them under my Hestra ski gloves, they were absolutely shredded to pieces.  If these gloves even smell velcro, they will fall apart. As you can imagine, this is a problem when adjusting your ski gloves.  I'm sure they have other uses, but they are too fragile for anything I would use them for.
review.name: Shredded after one day of use

review.reviewBody: Love these gloves. I tend to start cold then overheat with gloves when starting in 40-50F weather on runs. I felt that these breath well enough that I stay warm throughout without overheating. My only caveat is that given how thin they are, I have unfortunately ripped a hole in the palms after taking a tumble on trail run.
review.name: Great with a caveat

name: Capilene Midweight Liner Glove

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Stylish look, very warm and comfortable.look and feel is great.
review.name: Wear it anywhere

review.itemreviewed: Joy Peak II Mid Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very nice, quality product. Perfect size. Thank you columbia, I am very pleased
review.name: Perfect

review.itemreviewed: Joy Peak II Mid Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat is very warm, especially for its thickness. The Omni Heat technology is very effective.
review.name: Very warm

review.itemreviewed: Joy Peak II Mid Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am very pleased with my jacket.  It is light weight and extremely warm which I love.  It has exceeded my expectations.  I was completely impressed and will definitely recommend this jacket to anyone needing to fill warm and cozy for those cold winter days.
review.name: Highly recommend this jacket, extremely warm.

review.itemreviewed: Joy Peak II Mid Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this coat! It looks sharp, is very light weight but very warm. The hood fits nicely--with or without a cap under it (against rain on glasses). I compared this to the Heavenly Long Hooded jacket and they are close, but this one looks just a smidgen nicer (shaped better around waist) and is slightly warmer due to the gold lining. I wish it had one more pocket (maybe a breast pocket for a phone so I don't have to fish it out of the zippered one inside).
review.name: Nice choice

review.itemreviewed: Joy Peak II Mid Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat is lightweight, sleek, and so warm!  I needed to remove my excuse for not getting outside to walk in the cold months and this coat is it.  Flexible, perfect length to cover my bottom, and definitely keeps me warm!
review.name: Keeps me warm while getting my steps in

review.itemreviewed: Joy Peak II Mid Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was VERY worried when I took this coat out of the package and realized how thin it was. I didn't think it could be warm, but went for a walk in 29 degree weather, and it kept me warm! I think it is due to the way all the seams are sealed and don't let any wind in, so it really holds your own body heat. It has a little hidden pocket inside on the chest next to the zipper, I thought that was cool. It also has the a little thumb hole on the cuffs you can use, the pockets kept my hands warm, they are in just the right spot. I will say the sizing is a bit off. The size guide on the website where you put your measurements, said I would be good in a L, but I could only have my arms down in it, if I lifted them to drive or push a shopping cart or stroller, the armpits DUG into me and I was left sore. So I returned it and got the XL. I will also add that I love the double zipper, this way you can unzip the bottom when you need to sit.
review.name: Surprisingly good

review.itemreviewed: Joy Peak II Mid Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wanted a quality coat that did not appear boxy & fit a woman's shape and I am not disappointed.  I very much recommend this light weight, warm and elegant coat.
review.name: Fits a woman's shape

review.itemreviewed: Joy Peak II Mid Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ordered for my high schooler great fit. And she feels warm in zero degree weather.  Shes 55 and 130 lbs we got a medium to wear over sweatshirts.
review.name: Flattering and warm

review.itemreviewed: Joy Peak II Mid Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This jacket fits weird. Its slim around the waist but then flows out. I bought a small based on the reviews. However, the way the coats is designed its a hit or miss.
review.name: Think twice before purchasing

name: Joy Peak II Mid Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: These pants are exactly what I was looking for. I do a lot of hiking and can easily get overheated. These are not insulated but they keep the wind off of you. They are so stretchy and I was able to do scrambling without any restriction. I got compliments on the color. They even have a extra protective layer at the ankle to protect from crampons. They have vents which i love
review.name: Perfect for snowy/alpine hikes

review.reviewBody: Worn resort skiing on a warm day, plenty windproof and functional. Boot zips at bottom opened up wide enough for alpine boots, the gaiter is a little tight though. These are also great for walking the dog in winter for a little warmth!
review.name: Form-Fitting and cute !

review.reviewBody: I was replacing my winter kit and purchased these pants to wear when trail-breaking in winter conditions. I paired it with light base layer leggings as I tend to overheat quickly. These pants were flexible and kept me dry and comfortable. I appreciated details such as the waist micro-adjustment and the side venting in particular to prevent clamminess on long hiking days. I winter camp and being able to shed these pants and hang to dry overnight was clutch. These pants are durable and held up to be scratched and scraped by rocks, branches, and boot changes without feeling cumbersome.
review.name: Great pants for outdoor winter activities

name: Trailbreaker Tour Pant - Women's

description: Buy the Gregory Katmai 65L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Katmai 65L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Katmai 65L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: 3rd trip with the plus size.  been working excellent.
review.name: plus size has fit me well!

review.reviewBody: Great for a few days. Love the pockets and placement.
This pack has all the features I was looking for. Flexible side pockets, big belt pockets and multiple areas to access the pack.
review.name: Great Bag

review.reviewBody: Worked well on my first trip, very comfortable for my taller frame. Packed a good amount of goodies into it

The frame and well padded hip belt make carrying weight very comfortable even for extended durations. The side access on the bag is extremely useful for accessing smaller items on the trail without having to empty the bag. After a year of consistent use, the bag has held up well without any real signs of wear. My only complaint is that the bag doesnt come with a rain cover as many bags in the same price range do.
review.name: Solid overnight pack

review.reviewBody:
Really durable, no damage or rips from extensive bushwhacking. Straps are all easy to use and work well. Definitely recommend.
Difficult to use a non Gregory brand hydration pack with the provided loop, had to improvise an adapter for my Camelbak bladder.

Im about a month away from using it on trail but carrying it around the house its very comfortable and much more sturdy than my cheap pack I previously had. Im excited to get out and put it to the test. Delivery was quick and Ive only heard great things about these packs. Hope they are all true!
review.name: Katmai 65 m/l

review.reviewBody: I took this on an 18 mile trip along the south olympic peninsula of Washington state. This thing holds a lot of gear and is very comfortable. I am a bigger person and it fit really well (even the hip belt). I definitely recommend Gregory products. This is great for your first real technical backpack. Definitely watch the fitting videos on the Gregory website. I also recommend purchasing the 2 or 3 liter water bladder from Gregory.
review.name: Excellent backpack

review.reviewBody: Fits great and super comfortable even with a lot of weight. Great for a long hike.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: The side zipper is a very convenient feature. I could dig stuff out of my bag without having to take everything out. The walking stick holders are very convenient. There are enough compartments in the bag to be able to organize your stuff and I found the bag itself to be extremely comfortable. Overall I would recommend if you need extra room and a comfortable bag.
review.name: Awesome bag

name: Katmai 65L Backpack

description: Buy the MountainFLOW Quick Wax online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Quick Wax
hasVariant.description: Buy the MountainFLOW Quick Wax online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Super easy to apply! Works very well!
review.name: Great Product!

review.reviewBody:
This wax works great as a quick and easy maintenance wax. 

As it says in the instructions, don?t use this right before a tour as you may have issues with your skins sticking. 

That said, the best off label use of this wax is removing skin glue from your bases! It literally works like a charm! (I?ve only tried with BD glide lite glue)  Also, if you?re working on your skins and get some glue on your fingers- try washing it off with soap and struggle or just wipe a bit of this wax on your fingers, watch the instant magic ?? and move on with your day.. literally worth buying this wax just for its ease of removing skin glue but also a great way to keep bases lubed. Not to mention it?s a better wax for the environment.. Wins x 3 = buy it.
review.name: Works Great!

review.reviewBody: Great wax. Easy to apply, just a quick buff and your on your way. Worked really great for variable conditions. I also love to support this company due to their environmentally products. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great wax!

name: Quick Wax

hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Runoff 2.5L Rain Parka - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Runoff 2.5L Rain Parka - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Runoff 2.5L Rain Parka - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This coat runs really large. I tried a medium, (Im usually wear either a medium or large top depending on style.) This would allow multiple garments underneath, arms are long and I found the zipper challenging to use even to try on.  Its a good length to cover legs and it is nice as a packable jacket for travel. I didnt reorder as it just wasnt that flattering and found the material uncomfortable.
review.name: Runs very large

review.reviewBody: I bought this coat for a recent trip to Europe.  I was looking for a coat that would was not bulky, that would pack well, and that was a bit longer and one that could be worn over other layers and not be snug.  I was also looking for a coat that had good ventilation.  This was a winner!
review.name: Great Raincoat for Layers

review.reviewBody: I love this raincoat. The fabric is so soft and lightweight that is packs like a dream. It also drapes so nicely so it feels stylish in sprite if it's oversized shape. I want oversize so I could put it over a fleece or a puffer. I just love it and am so happy I found it as it's not a common fabric or shape
review.name: The perfect raincoat

review.reviewBody: This serves my purpose as a travel jacket that can be crushed down to fit inside a purse.  It's that lightweight!  It is huge.  I'm a women's size 12 and got a Medium, and there is at least one foot of looseness around my hips.  Luckily, the sleeves can be closed with the velcro so that they aren't flapping around.  The zipper is two-way, but it gets stuck really easily in the seam.  Overall, still overpriced for what you get.
review.name: Absolutely huge; extremely light-weight

review.reviewBody: Listen, I have a big butt. Other longline rain parkas Ive owned have fit too tight around my booty, making layering impossible, and it just didnt look right or feel comfortable. This Backcountry parka is gloriously spacious, especially in the butt, leaving me plenty of room to layer up underneath while still leaving room for movement. The look is oversized and cool. Highly recommended for folks with butts of all sizes.
review.name: Roomy for this booty

review.reviewBody: I just purchased this and wore it for the first time in light rain. After 45 minutes in light rain, nearly a mist, I had wet patches coming through on the back and arms.
review.name: Not waterproof

review.reviewBody: So hard to find a truest waterproof , long rain shell jacket. I wish I could get it in more colors. Love the oversized fit so I can wear warmer clothing underneath when its colder out. Get lots of compliments.  Please bring back in stock!
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody:
I have many rain coats and rain jackets; North Face , Patagonia, Helly Hansen, you name it Ive go it.
But this Runoff 2.5 rain parka is absolutely the best of the bunch. Its got the asian urban chic vibe and its light weight and perfect for summer rain. It is so cool; I get so many complements and everyone wants to know where i bought it. 
I love this raincoat, its NOT sticky and uncomfortable even in the most muggy humid conditions. Buy this coat, you will be blown away but its performance.
review.name: The Best Coolest Raincoat Ever

review.reviewBody: everything about this jacket is big including the neck opening
review.name: big and shapeless

review.reviewBody:
I have been looking for a rain coat that I can layer over lightweight puffers in this crazy spring we're having, and Backcountry nailed it with this parka!! I bought the black color, and wore it for a week in the city during a rainstorm - it kept me so warm and looking so cute. I really like the slight drop in the back, and the fact that the zipper doesn't go all the way to the hem - makes walking a bit easier, although there is a 2 way zipper so you can just hike it up if that's easier too. 

This coat does run maybe a little large, but I love that look for layering and freedom of movement.
review.name: Perfect Rain Coat for Layering

name: Runoff 2.5L Rain Parka - Women's
Runoff 2.5L Rain Parka - Women's

hasVariant.name: Handlebar Mirror
hasVariant.description: Buy the Spurcycle Handlebar Mirror online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Handlebar Mirror
hasVariant.description: Buy the Spurcycle Handlebar Mirror online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My Garmin Varia Radar was a game changer, so much so that I wont ride without one!  This little inexpensive mirror is even more of a game changer.  I use both on my rides.  The radar lets you know if there is something behind you and gives you an idea about how close and how fast they are approaching but this little jewel lets you know pretty much everything that is going on and for a good distance.  It is a HUGE bang for your buck concerning safety!  It looks nice, very discreet, and the build quality is excellent and only adds a little weight to your ride.  I chose the 50 mm size and I can see in detail, so I cant speak for the 35mm version.  A while back I tried a helmet mirror, told myself that I was going to give it time to get used to it but I absolutely hated it, I found that it was very difficult to position ones head so you could actually consistently see what was behind so I removed it on the first rideI DID NOT LIKE IT!  Not so with the handlebar mirror.  I was super pleased with it on my first ride and it has become a part of me so I now use it without really giving it a thought.  Some folks consider things like this a little uncool I suppose?  For the price, it is worth a try.  Even if you ended up not keeping it on your bike, but would be surprised if you didnt.
review.name: Get One!  Another Safety Game Changer!

name: Handlebar Mirror

review.reviewBody: Great jacket, fits on the slimmer side but with plenty of stretch- size up if you want a but more room to layer or move around. Material feels better than a traditional soft shell, has held up very well in rain and snow. Sits a little longer in the back.
review.name: Slim fit, great material

review.reviewBody: Best soft shell I own.  Durable, technical, right fit and everything I need, nothing I don't on the softshell. Mountain Hardwear produces top notch quality technical gear for the alpine environment.  Best American outdoor wear apparel company with products on the level of Arcteryx.  Keep it up Mountain Hardwear!
review.name: My Go To Alpine Soft Shell

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this jacket a few months back as a winter mountaineering layering piece.

It has since become much more than that.

This jacket is super stretchy, moves with you in every way you want and it's light weight. It packs into it's own pocket, which I rarely use since I'm always wearing it. The low profile hood fits under a helmet nicely. The water resistance is unbelievable, so much so, that I wore it in the shower to fully test it. The water just beads off. The 2 hand warmer pockets are easily accessible while wearing a harness. And still accessible when wearing a pack. (Not as much as just a harness.) The chest pocket is cavernous. It runs from the top of the jacket down to almost the bottom. Easily holds map, compass, gps, phone, teddy bear, or whatever you like to take on your climb/hike. The single pull hem adjustment is awesome for a quick fit.

I'm 5' 11" and weigh in at 180lbs give or take a few. I ordered a medium first. It was tight in the chest with no room for layering. Ended up with the large. Just baggy enough for a base layer and microchill fleece. Sleeves are slightly long, but that's due to the large sizing.

I've had this jacket beyond its limits I believe. It's only somewhat wind resistant, so I've tested at a variety of altitudes. 13,700' being the highest yet. It wasn't until the winds were gusting over 50mph, (wind chill was around -17F) that I had to add another layer over the Chockstone. And as long as the snow isn't blizzard like conditions you'll stay dry. (The Colorado mountains never disappoint in the winter.)

This is now my go to jacket. Taking the dog out, grocery store, nightlife, etc. It is a super comfy and sharp looking jacket. (MHW gear always makes you look cool.) Its one of my favorite purchases yet. I definitely recommend. If you use this jacket for what it was designed, you will not be disappointed.

If you feel you need a heavier alpine climbing jacket, check out the mixaction jacket. It's just as excellent with a little more burliness.
review.name: Phenomenal softshell!

name: Chockstone Alpine Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Love this! The color is so fun and the crop fit is flattering!
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody: Color is a little brighter in person, but so cute and soft. I'm 5'9" and 135lbs and the medium is perfect.
review.name: Would buy again

review.reviewBody: Pretty disappointed. Very very short and I am short bodied. Fleece has a cheap feel and look. Have purchased better fleece from northface before. Not the quality that it used to be at least for this piece.
review.name: Too short /cheap feel

review.reviewBody: Women's Extreme Pile 2 Full-Zip Jacket: runs a little large BUT I love it. This is my second one of these jackets. It is super warm but not big and cumbersome. If you're on the fence about whether or not to spend the moolah for this jacket. DO IT! It's well worth the investment.
review.name: Well worth it!

review.reviewBody: Wow this fleece isn't too big but it keeps you warm down to like 40 degrees F. It's the perfect fall/early winter jacket to throw on instead of a coat. It has a nice look and comes with an adjustable waistband. You could probably size down but I went for my usual size and it has a boxier look and sweaters fit inside.
review.name: Very warm fleece, great look

review.reviewBody: Perfect weight for late fall and beyond. Jacket is cut with plenty of room to layer with a hoodie. Two side pockets and a zippered gear/phone pocket on the chest. Fully lined and an option to adjust the waist. I'm 5'4", 110 lbs and the XS fit great with plenty of room and length in the sleeves.
review.name: Great Pile Jacket

review.reviewBody: So warm and fluffy. Perfect for PNW early fall. Layer it up for more warmth. It has become my new favorite jackets.
review.name: Obsessed

review.reviewBody: The jacket is so warm and the color is beautiful and it's so nice and soft!
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket!! Colors are so cute and fit is nice. I bought a medium and it's true to size (5'6 and 135 lbs).
review.name: FAVORITE PURCHASE

review.reviewBody: Cozy Sherpa. Side pockets don't zip but they are quite deep. Chest pocket has a zipper. Smooth lining allows for easy layering over hoodies. Love the slight crop and tonal colors!
review.name: Great Sherpa full zip jacket

review.itemreviewed: Grilled Chicken and Mushroom Wild Rice Pilaf
review.reviewBody: After a day of backpacking, I was really looking forward to dinner. Sat up my stove and opened this bag and the smell coming from this bag was amazing. After adding my boiling water and letting this sit, it was time to indulge. This was very tasty and filling. The aroma, and layers of flavor was surprising to say the least. It has chunks of chicken, pilaf, and spices that are filling, and packed with nutrients to help recoup from a long days hike. This is definitely on the top of my list of recurring purchases! Highly recommend for sure.
review.name: Great Taste and LOTS of Flavor

name: Grilled Chicken and Mushroom Wild Rice Pilaf

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Wide - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is what happens when private equity (CSC Generation Enterprise purchased Back Country) buys out a company -- the quality of everything goes down to make the company "profitable." I'm guessing everything is junk now and I would have no confidence in anything on this site.  I own other Oboz hiking boots and these are nothing like those in terms of quality. The sizing was ridiculously small and narrow -- not wide or a 6.5. Private equity is ruining our country.
review.name: Terrible fit and lousy quality

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Wide - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my second version of this boot. My first pair lasted years, and I absolutely loved them. I wore these new boots for a long weekend of hiking (30+ miles) with no problems. No break-in required. Next, the day before starting a two-week backpacking trip in Europe, I experienced terrible right Achilles pain. On closer examination, the inside back of the right shoe above the heel was not completely smooth and was rubbing against my Achilles, causing a lump to develop. I was fortunate enough to be near outdoor goods stores when this happened. I bought another pair of hiking shoes and started the backpacking trip the next day. I was forced to abandon these boots due to the extra and useless weight. It was such a bummer to leave them behind, but I couldnt wear them without pain.
review.name: Defective shoe

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Wide - Women's
Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Wide - Women's
review.reviewBody:
These are great if you want to LOOK like you go hiking, but they are too light-duty for the actual activity.

I  bought these hoping for a decent hiking boot for day hikes and the occasional weekend trip. They look well-made, but the leather and sides are flimsy - they don't have nearly enough ankle and side support for a mid-rise hiking boot. 

If you want to "hike" on groomed and paved paths with these they'd be great, but I'm not even going to bother with them on an actual trail. Back they go!
review.name: Cute, but flimsy!

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Wide - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is the 4th pair that I have owned. Absolutely LOVE them. After bunion and toe surgeries I need a wide toe box, and these come in a wide width. They are very comfortable all around and the huckleberry and pink colors are anything but boring. I like the mid rise, but would like it if they were available low cut as well.
review.name: Comfy and cute

name: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Wide - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have wide feet and ordered 1/2 size up. I really like them. I've worn on short hikes in damp weather. They were very comfortable, handled walking over rocks well and my feet stayed dry. They are lightweight so not sure if they would work out as well on a long hike.
review.name: Nice lightweight hiking shoe

review.reviewBody: Lightweight warm weather shoes with great cushioning. I ordered up 1/2 size and theyre a perfect fit. I wouldnt wear these on the trail, but theyre perfect for my 3-mile brisk walks on sidewalks and pavements. And the colorthe green/grey/pink combois fun.
review.name: I love the fit and the color
comment: Thanks for the great feedback!

review.reviewBody: I love Merrell Moabs, wear them every day and have 5 pair. But as hot as this summer has been, I wanted a pair of lighter weight shoes. I started with Merrell styles, but had no luck getting a good fit for my problem feeta neuroma and plantar fasciitis on one foot and a bunion on the other. I also tried styles from all the highly rated shoes for walking, including those with gel insoles. They all bothered my neuroma, and the gels were so bouncy they made me feel a little unsteady on my feet. So I went back to Merrell and tried the speed solo, ordered up a half size, and finally found my fit! The shoes seemed narrow at first, but after wearing them a couple of times, theyre as comfortable as my Moabs.
review.name: Finally found my fit!

review.reviewBody: I had big toe joint implant surgery, and these Merrell sneakers keep my toe stable, so it doesn't hurt after a long walk or hike.  So comfortable when walking and hiking!  The fit is perfect and good support.
review.name: Best sneaker ever, I have 3 pairs of them.

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my daughter for a summer trip to Iceland and she loved them. She has a wider foot and I sized up which worked out perfect (normally shes a 6 or 6.5 and I purchased 7). These were great for hiking on uneven terrain.
review.name: Great!
comment: Thank you for sharing your awesome experience!

review.reviewBody: I love these hiking shoes! I took them hiking in the PNW, and they were very supportive and still held up really well on very rocky trails. They especially felt very good descending on hikes, they did not hurt your toes like a lot of other shoes/boots do. I ordered a half size up, but they are pretty true to size. They are waterproof, expect for the mesh on top. They were perfect!
review.name: Super Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: These are so comfortable, I buy them every time I need shoes for work where I do plenty of standing and shuffling around in the office, these are a life saver dream too walk on, including every day use and during wet climate. Perfect.
review.name: COMFORTABLE DURABLE
comment: Thank you for sharing your positive feedback!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable shoe with a roomy toe box.  I was surprised with the level of comfort.  The only issue is that they run small. Too bad I wore mine outside . I would have exchanged for a half size larger

review.reviewBody: My third pair just arrived. I walk my dog in these shoes every day. They are supportive, comfortable, true to size, and waterproof. I wore them to Las Vegas in 100 degrees and thru a Western Pa winter. Love them!
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: They are too small.   I have ordered Merrell sneakers before and the size 10 fits perfectly, but the Speed Solo are too tight (width and length).

review.itemreviewed: Sawtooth X Low Shoe - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: The Sawtooth X is an... adequate?... shoe, but definitely in no way a great shoe. They're not in the same league as the shoe they replaced: the Sawtooth 2 - which was truly great. They're heavier, less well-ventilated - so hotter, narrower - even as a wide, the tread is less aggressive, and Oboz went with flat laces going through holes instead of round laces going through webbing loops so they're hard to tie properly. They're almost a parody of a light hiking shoe - made more for running errands or strolling garden paths than for actual hiking trails.
review.name: A sad replacement for the Sawtooth 2

review.itemreviewed: Sawtooth X Low Shoe - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: I need wide in Oboz, so bought these to replace the old Sawtooths that I have had several pair of and loved. These are dogs. Not even close to the old style. Sort of a clunky street shoe is my take. Old Sawtooths were my favorite shoe. These new ones suck!
review.name: Very disappointing!

review.itemreviewed: Sawtooth X Low Shoe - Wide - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is the shoe for you if you love the wide fit of the older Sawtooth II. Fits great and definitely roomier compared to the standard version of this shoe. They come with a nice supportive and cushioned insole that provides a ton of comfort. They fit great out of the box, breathe really well, and have a super grippy rubber tread. The quality is great and if these are anything like mine I'd bet on them lasting forever!
review.name: Do it all hiker now comes in WIDE

name: Sawtooth X Low Shoe - Wide - Men's

review.reviewBody: This comes with a removeable waist belt that comes stashed inside the jacket in the "pocket" where the foam spine protector is.
review.name: Waist Belt Location

review.reviewBody: I bought this chest armor since I had a rib injury from a  fall from snowboarding. I stand 4 ft 11 inches (59 inches) petite female. I followed the size guide which I say is accurate. I have not tried snowboarding yet but I tried it on . Its not too loose but not too tight. enough to be able to move my extremities and bend forward and backward. I still have very  good range of motion. my only comment is that sleeves are too long for me.  I wore it under my snowboard jacket and still able to fit in my small jacket.
review.name: Great for short people too

review.reviewBody:
I really like mine. It's not as 'burly' as POC makes it sound--you can definitely use it for everyday riding if it's below about 60 out. If you're going to wear a long-sleeve jersey anyway, might as well make it armor. 

This comes with a pretty beefy back protector with small perforations (removable), three flexible layers of VPD on the chest (removable), integrated shoulder pads (non-removable), and integrated elbow pads (non-removable). It's comfortable for trail riding, with the only caveat being the back protector occasionally rides up. The included cummerbund thing helps with this though (heads up--it's tucked inside the back protector pocket if you can't find yours). 

Sizing: I got a L/XL. I'm 5'11", 185, 43.5" chest. Fits great and the zipper makes it easy to get on. The back armor and sleeves are a little too long, but it's a minor issue. I've washed mine a couple times (in a laundry bag) with no issues. 

I did fall on my back once in a slow-speed crash, and was glad I was wearing this. I won't ride without back armor again unless it's just too hot. The crash did punch a small hole in the mesh carrier, but I can't ding POC for that. You need all the ventilation you can get.

Overall, it's a great setup and makes you a more confident rider willing to push it a bit harder. For me, that's worth it. 

Aside--avoid the POC VPD tee and get this. There is no advantage to the tee.
review.name: Really nice. Usable for trail riding

name: Spine VPD 2.0 Jacket

hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon QST X Ski - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: QST X Ski - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon QST X Ski - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Well built and hard charger. I feel the recommendation for the mount is a bit too far forward. But in untouched powder this thing will do everything with style.
review.name: Qst x

review.reviewBody: Honestly hard to compare this ski to blank, different tools for different settings. What a refreshing taste of a real powder ski that is definitely light enough for the up that will leave you more than pleased on the way back down (thank you solomon, I love you). These things want soft snow like a heat seeking missile. The Karuba/poplar blended core seems to push through and get up and over variable snow without issue. Understand that the ski wants to be in sustained untracked snow with equal ability to make large open turns and quick, slashy, surfy turns on the flip of a switch. This ski has lots of pop, for freeride skiers this ski would be a ton of fun as a dedicated pow ski, landing also felt freakishly good and solid given the stated weight and construction.  You guys knocked this one out of the park, cheers!
review.name: Finally, a real pow ski

review.reviewBody: Having a longer radius than its cousin, the  QST X picks up where the QST Blank left off! A little wider, more of a damp forgiving feel, and a longer turn radius give this ski an incredible feel in deep snow. I was able to drift and pivot the ski with ease and float through some really deep snow. When I skied into more varied snow conditions the longer radius really helped make for a more comfortable ride.  Both the Blank and the X are amazing powder skis, but in my opinion the X is more specific in being a total deep snow slayer! Ps my wife skis the 178cm and absolutely loves it!
review.name: This ski is a total pow weapon!!!

review.reviewBody: I had the opportunity to demo this ski in Crested Butte during some fresh and choppy conditions. The X feels like the playful slarvy brother of the QST Blank. I found the Blank a little directional for my style and this ski played more to my preferences. It has a lower swing weight and more forgiveness than the Blank, this comes at the cost of some dampness, drive-ability, and edge hold. It also vaguely reminded me of a heavier, more charg-y, Bent Chetler 120. Would be a great daily driver for a primarily playful creative skier who also likes to charge and lives in a high snow zone.
review.name: Playful, forgiving, and there when you need it.

review.reviewBody: The QST X has been such a let down. I was hoping for would be a more twin shaped wider Blank with that carbon to stiffen it a bit for big drops. Its not, its just a wider 106, the ski feels lifeless and bland. The tip and tale chatter but the waist is so stiff you cant actually use the tips on anything other than 2 feet of snow. The ski doesnt want to turn. I am just going to mount a pin binding and use it for bowl skiing.
review.name: Coulda been better
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.name: Bummer isn't made in 171cm like the old model

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great sleeping bag. Zipped up it is very warm, material is very comfortable and can be opened up when the conditions are warmer. Used in winter and summer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'd highly recommend this sleeping bag! Its very comfortable to sleep in, and I really appreciated the option to connect it to another bag. Plus, the design is great and it kept me warm throughout the night.
review.name: Great sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this sleeping bag. The zipper in the foot box is great for cooling my hot feet.
review.name: Love this sleeping bag. The

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great bag so far! Very warm and incredibly light. All the variations for air flow, capable of zipping to another bag is great
review.name: Great bag so far! Very

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best sleeping bag Ive ever owned. I love the fact that both sides and feet unzip for ventilation. It fits just as the website said it did length wise, plenty of room for me being a larger guy. There is also a pocket inside that fits my phone perfect but if you had an iPhone max it probably wouldnt fit
review.name: Ascent sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Hands down the best sleeping bag on the planet. If I was ever cold this is the bag I would want with me. The packaging is great. It folds down so little so it can go anywhere. So lightweight and durable. 10 out of 10 hands down the best!! Very durable and comfortable.
review.name: The best of the best!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As soon as you open the bag this feels like a high quality sleeping bag. The material is super soft and doesnt sound scratchy so its not noisy when rolling over. The down lining is very warm so like it says it will be perfect for cold weather camping. The versatility of all of the zippers and openings make this not only a sleeping bag but a comfy blanket or almost coat that could be easily worn sitting by the campfire. I love the fact that it comes with both a compact bag for traveling and a storage bag as that allows for both easy travel and storage.
review.name: A fabulous sleeping bag

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently received the Sea to Summit Ascent Down Sleeping Bag Unisex for free from Influenster in exchange for my honest review, and I couldn't be happier with it! No more renting gear when my husband and I go camping on Catalina Island or explore the parks in California.

First and foremost, the comfort of this sleeping bag is unparalleled. It feels incredibly soft and cozy, ensuring a restful night's sleep even in cooler temperatures. The insulation is top-notch, keeping me warm without overheating, which is perfect for the varying climates we encounter on our trips.

In terms of durability, the quality of the materials used is evident. Its built to withstand the rigors of outdoor adventures and has held up beautifully against rough terrain and frequent use. Additionally, the sleeping bag's versatility is a huge plus. It adapts well to different sleeping conditions, making it a reliable companion whether were in a tent or under the stars.

The packaging was also impressive. It came compactly packed, making it easy to store and transport without taking up too much space in our gear. Overall, I highly recommend the Sea to Summit Ascent Down Sleeping Bag for anyone looking to enhance their camping experience with comfort, durability, and versatility.
review.name: Warmth, Durability, Packability.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was amazed at the lightness of this sleeping bag. Honestly I was all doubts at its durability and versatility but boy was I wrong. I have never been kept so warm and comfortable while camping. The design is amazing, especially the little pouch foe necessitates when your all zippes up. My whole family will be using one of these next trip. Thank ya'll.
review.name: What a Sleeping bag!!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ive used this sleeping during winter and still using in Utah. Lastly, I camped at Zion and I had a great experience for all of my stays. Firstly, the size is super good, Im 55, 140lb and I still have a lot of room. The sleeping bag is really easy to pack and carry and as a plus lightweight! I didnt have any problem while hiking it too. It incredibly soft and you can use the zipper to open anywhere. When I wake up I usually just wanna keep my feet open, and with this bag, I can do that easily just by using the zipper for the feet! So far, after camping in the wild, nothing happened to it, so it is durable and deserves the money. I am kind of a person who is cold all the time but after starting to use this sleeping bag, I dont get cold at nights but I have to add, I use my sleeping pad under my sleeping bag, this couple is like the perfect combo! I cant wait to use it more!! Highly highly recommended!
review.name: Super warm, cozy and lightweight!

name: Ascent Sleeping Bag: 30F Down

review.reviewBody: The shorts feel soft and flexible, they were comfortable. True to size. The liner was not so much, it felt tight and not too supportive. Way too small for a size L.... My biggest issue is that while riding, the pad of the liner shorts crumpled into a ball, half outside of it's sleeve, no more support. I tried it a few ways but it does not stay in place, feels like it needs to be stitched into place.
review.name: I really wanted to like them...

review.reviewBody:
I needed a pair of shorts for those days when I want to just ride the cruiser or the "around-town" single speed bike.  This fits the bill.  Minimal chamois doesn't crowd me up when I stop for coffee yet gives just enough cushion for the ride.  

Another feature:  Don't like the chamois in there full-time?  Just get some scissors and cut it out.  (Held in simply by stretchy small strings).  Now you have a removable chamois that you can either wear the whole time or just when you need it.  Great idea, PI!

I recommend!
review.name: Great 2-IN-1 Shorts!

name: Prospect 2/1 Short With Liner - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This shirt is very light weight, comfy and good quality
review.name: Short

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very light weight. Perfect if you get hot easily. Also great fit.
review.name: Very light weight.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good quality but poor sizing. Columbia needs to join the global standards. I wear a LG in everything so I ordered a LG. I know Colu mbia recommends I order a medium but it's hard to trust recommendations from companies. I trust my own purchase history more. Wow! When I received this shirt it was way too big! The rest of the World would call it an extra LG or even 2X LG. I already cut the tags off so I'm going to attempt to dry the crap out of it on high heat in an attempt to shrink it.
review.name: Good quality, bad sizing.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfort is key and this is best Tackle to have on when being active
review.name: Awesome Tackle

review.reviewBody: This shirt was worn twice, once at a pool and not in the water, once at the beach in the water, and is less than 2 months old. The sleeve stitching has totally separated on one side and now coming apart on another. I have cheap no name shirts which have been used the same way for years which look like new in comparison. I should have read the reviews on this shirt more carefully as you can see this is a normal problem. Columbia is happy to keep selling poor quality, then if you submit a warranty claim, they want to charge you for shipping it back, and then decide IF its a warranty issue. This is the last Columbia item I will be purchasing as I have had similar quality issues with other garmets purchased recently (short/pant sizing, cuffs fraying, etc.)
review.name: Columbia Quality is Non-Existent, Buy other Brands
comment: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback!

review.reviewBody: The Shaman lace up LV has been my absolute favorite shoe since it came out. The flexibility in the midsole, along with the downturn and edging ability make it such a great shoe for all types of terrain. The Shaman Lace LV fit my foot perfectly (1/2 size up from street size) straight out of the box and I was instantly comfortable trying hard wearing them. They are also amazingly comfortable for an aggressive shoe. Highly recommend trying these, especially if you enjoy small crimps and overhang!
review.name: My favorite!

review.reviewBody: excellent light weight jacket, strong material and a nice color.  Will be good for hikes, windy climbing days and packs down to stow small in a pack.
review.name: Nice lightweight all use jacket

review.reviewBody: This jacket is not waterproof and hardly water repellent.
review.name: not waterproof, save your money.

review.reviewBody: This should probably be called a wind breaker. Doesnt keep you dry.
review.name: Not a rain jacket

review.reviewBody: Can't believe something to light can be so waterproof!
review.name: Super light and packable

review.reviewBody: Fantastic jacket, and exactly what was hoped for. Sturdy enough to wear, but light enough to throw in a bag for eventualities.
review.name: Fantastic Jacket

review.reviewBody: I should have watched some video reviews before buying this jacket. I use a Grundens rain jacket for recreational fishing in Alaskan rivers and I was looking to get a replacement. This jacket was a flash deal and I bought it not knowing what its meant to be for. Its a very thin jacket that folds into a small triangular pocket, wrinkles easy after removing it from that pocket, and it appears to be a jacket geared towards runners. If youre looking for a lightweight shell where you expect to be very active, this is for you. If you want to hike in wet conditions, or fish rivers, or go on a boat ride, find another jacket.
review.name: Thin and lightweight

review.reviewBody: Not a rain jacket. Wetted out in 15 minutes in Newfoundland. It is a great windbreaker and is easy to carry cycling in a back pocket. I washed it and retreated it but alas,- it is only a wind shell. I would not rely on this in the back country for rain protection. But I do like it for a light weight wind jacket to carry.
review.name: Not a Rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: Jacket great for light rain. Only issue I had was lack of pockets and small chest pocket size. Otherwise works well for shedding the rain!
review.name: Definitely Ultralight

review.reviewBody: This shell delivers no water gets through, Its still got a little breathability and it will stay in the backpacking kit indefinitely. If youre working or ripping through thick brush Id be careful, it should come as no surprise that ultra light is often inversely proportionate to ultra durable
review.name: Its gettin the job done up here

review.reviewBody: I own several OR garments and I'm happy with all of them.  The Helium Rain Jacket is one of the best light weight rain jackets out there.
review.name: Typical OR quality

review.reviewBody: I am very picky with my packs, as I believe everyone should be, but this pack was everything I was needing and more. Many convenient pockets and storage space, and as an organizer I appreciate being able to keep different things separate. Sturdy hip belt and many minor adjustments can be made to custom fit this to your body shape, making your trips all the more simple. The color is also gorgeous. I will be sticking with this pack for years to come.
review.name: Great distance pack

review.reviewBody: I've just bought this pack and only used it for a couple of day hikes so far but loaded it up with 30 lbs and have been very happy with how it feels and the adjustability of the pack. I had originally purchased the Kalmia but just could never get it adjusted to feel right so I exchanged it for the Deva and am much happier with it. The quality of the pack  seems very well constructed and based on Gregory's reputation I have no doubt that it will hold up for many many years to come.
review.name: Great pack so far...

review.reviewBody:
I used this pack on a 5 day trek earlier this summer. I purchased it specifically for the organization capabilities. There are pockets all over and I can separate out my stuff so that I can find it easily. The waist belt pockets are a bit small, but I used a hip pack in addition to the backpack, and that worked for me. 
I love the fact that I can attach things to the outside for quick access. I have my camp shoes (Merrells) attached to a carabiner on the back and can attach my trekking poles to the sides when not in use. 
Looking forward to taking it to Philmont next year as well as shakedown hikes in between.

I love Gregory backpacks and the fit of it for my body on my back, hips, and spine is really wonderful. I have used this one for backpack camping and is my main backpack for Car Camping to store items that aren't in boxes. I think they did a great job with the structure of it and technology in order for it to fit women's bodies. Brava
review.name: Super Comfortable and Great for Backpack Camping

review.reviewBody: This backpack is great! I used it on one backpacking trip so far and I loved it! Seems like the people that designed the backpack thought of just about everything. I was able to stick my bladder bag in there and all my other gear with some extra room. There are so many pockets for organization and quick access. I also liked the color and design of the pack (I got eggplant). The bag is a bit heavy on its own which isnt great but it provides a lot of support and has stiff straps that go around the waist, taking a lot of the weight off your back, so I think its worth it.
review.name: So much space and pockets!

review.reviewBody:
Had a Gregory Deva XS, burgundy as my first pack bought several yrs ago. It carried all my stuff. Invested since then (2020) several
pricey,
"UL" packs from different vendors, yet, I keep coming back to the Deva. It seems to fit me the best as I am short waisted. I have taken this pack literally all over the world.
I used it many times in dreadful conditions. The pack pockets are small and the zippered one freezes; I 
don't use the pockets anyway, opting for a fanny pack. Ive tried many others, but this product really fits well, and has held up. I am careful with my stuff but eventually, the fibers give up. I have not experienced any failures in the fibers or disasters of any sort. I do, however, take the pack ON the plane with me, so it's not thrown around by Baggage Loaders; I am really partial.o it.
It holds inside my poles and water bladder. Invested in a magnet for the chest and some other auxiliary items which were well worth the additional expense.
I can carry my tent, sleeping bag; clothes, cookware; filtration stuff and other necessities easily. I am a 70+ female.
review.name: fits the best

review.reviewBody:
The only drawback of this pack is the base weight. Fortunately, I'm used to rucking, and as of now, I haven't done any long thru-hikes, so the ultralight isn't as much of a priority for me.

This pack is comfortable, spacious, and easy to keep things organized. It is highly customizable to your frame. 

I splurged on it for my first backpacking pack, as I know the value of investing in quality up front after rucking for years. I am very happy with my decision!
review.name: It has a place for everything!

review.reviewBody: I've taken this pack on multiple multi-day backpacking trips and I always carry 15-20 lbs of photography gear and I can barely feel that weight! Also straps are compatible with PD camera clip + you can use all the pockets on the sides/top for quick access to multiple lenses.
review.name: love the layout

review.reviewBody:
I went on a 12-day backpacking trek with my 14-year old daughter last summer. She was 5 tall and 100#s. I was worried she wouldnt be able to carry all her own gear so I upsized the pack Id been using for 15-years to this Gregory Deva. I liked that it had exterior pockets. My older pack has nice size pockets and I really appreciate the way they help me organize everything, especially in bear country where you need to know where your smellables are for efficient, effective removal to bear bags. The pockets on the Deva are situated differently on the pack, which does affect how much I can put in them. It also makes it a little harder to have a hiking partner remove things because theyre a little hard to find. But theyre there and noticeably missing on most packs these days to save weight. 

The Deva fit well to my body, held my hydration bladder well, and carried the load well. I recommend if you need a large pack.
review.name: Works well for long-term backpacking

review.reviewBody:
Awesome pack, just got back from a 5 day hike in the Sawtooth Wilderness where my wife hiked with it for 5 days. It performed flawlessly, she loved it. Which is saying something considering she had never done anything close to what she accomplished up and down the Sawtooth Mountains. 

 Very lightweight, durable, and comfortable.
review.name: Awesome Backpack

name: Deva 60L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Apex Pedal System was the icing on the cake for me. Having multiple herniated discs, I wanted to have the option of using my legs to help me paddle if I encountered pain or fatigue. It is easy to add or remove, depending on your journey. I often chart a lengthy paddle to a waterfall or remote area and that is all good on paper and in my mind. Then the return trip can be a beast and the Apex helps with that burden.
review.name: APEX makes a World of Difference!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Apex pedal drive was one of the must haves for my setup. I can go farther and faster to fishing spots without wearing myself out. I like that I can lift the drive out of port and paddle around when desired.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Too many parts and attachments. Need to simplify assembly.
review.name: Too many parts and attachments.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Easy to pedal, way easier than a bike. Lots of power/speed and relative easy to install. The bag package it comes with is useful, but Ive never needed it. The pedal drive has a wire attached to the pin that not only keeps it from falling off, but can wrap around to hold it all together when transporting.
review.name: Easy to install, powerful to use

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] its a great system. Especially nice when you are in a current or against the wind. Can be a bit tricky at first to pull it back out, but works well.
review.name: its a great system. Especially

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First time using this concept. I recently SUP the snake river in Twin Falls, Idaho. West of Pillar Falls and heading east to Shoshone Falls. You will need to PADDLE both ways. The current one way, and the wind (breeze) coming back. The pedaling is going to be make such a difference.
review.name: Don't paddle if you can pedal.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So awesome !!!!!!! no one hand fighting a pike and the other with a paddle control of the board
review.name: So awesome !!!!!!! no one

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Easy to assemble and install in my Lono Aero upon testing at home. Very excited to try it in the water soon!
review.name: Going to love switching between paddling and pedaling!

review.reviewBody: Been using Devil's Canyon for several years and Korkers in general all the way back to their 1st gen boots.  I have no issues with the BOA system at all.  They stay tight and never come undone like laces. As for soles, get the Triple Threat Aluminum bars soles and wade anywhere.  They are better than felt for traction and hold no invasive stuff. Use Korkers sizing guide to get the correct fit.
review.name: Love 'em!

review.reviewBody:
Disappointed in these for several reasons: 

1) BOA technology is prone to failure. When wearing stocking foot waders, the BOA loosens as I walk. This leads to rolled ankles. When wearing wading socks, the left BOA tends to seize up once tighten down & I need to use a piece of metal to pry it open (this also happens w/ my Burton snowboarding boots) Net: BOA is a nice idea, prone to a variety of failure. Will not purchase BOA tech for any footwear again.

2) Lack of ankle support. May be fine in small freshwater streams / rivers, but in the kelp-covered Boulder fields of the Atlantic coast it?s incredibly dangerous

3) provided spikes are insufficient, if you want real grip you need to purchase $60 carbide spike soles. These fall out easily (I?ve gone through 4 pairs), but some lock-tight and an Allen wrench will increase longevity. 

Anyone considering these for surfcasting & applications on or around wet boulders... consider a laced version of korkers instead. Buy the carbide spike soles & apply lock-tight before tightening down w/ Allen wrench
review.name: Meh

name: Devil's Canyon Wading Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Fabric used in this jacket is perfect for the changeable weather of Bogota Colombia. good breathability and perfect to protect your chest in the cold weather downhill. the only bad thing for me is that I use to buy L size for jackets in other brands and this brand is quite bigger, I should buy an M size.
review.name: perfect for the weather of Bogota

review.reviewBody:
Love this jacket. Perfect for those chilly starts or for me, rides that approach our big Great Lake, where temp could drop 15 degrees suddenly. Better answer than arm warmers since it gives your chest protection from wind. Great ventilation on back for breathability but note it will not protect from rain.  Packs super tiny but I haven't figured out how to origami it into the built in stuff sack. I get a ball-with-arms every time. But it is a small ball that fits easily in a jersey pocket. Great fit for me -- form fitting without feeling like a straight jacket.

If they had my size and color (I don't like wearing dark colors on road for visibility) I would order a couple more!!!
review.name: Perfect for those chilly starts

review.reviewBody: Very glad I purchased this footprint for my tent. I really love that it extends into the vestibule areas.
review.name: great to have

review.reviewBody: Works well for the Eureka Space Camp 6 tent. It rained twice the weekend we camped and inside the tent was dry-
review.name: Works great!

review.reviewBody: Kinda small and hard to orient. A more useful footprint would be rectangular and extent a food-or-so beyond the vestibules. And maybe color-code the long ends.
review.name: Too small, and I'd have preferred a simpler shape
comment: Thank you for your review. Any footprint used under a tent need to be completely covered and NO fabric should extend outward. Any groundsheet which protrudes from under the tent, at any point, has potential to catch and funnel rainwater between the groundsheet and the tent floor!

review.reviewBody: Love it because it makes the area under the rain fly an extension of the tent.
review.name: Covers area under tent and rain fly.

review.reviewBody: Vary spacious for a four person tent.  Nice storage and durable material.
review.name: Spacious

review.reviewBody: Simply wish it was easier to figure out which was front and back of the ground cover so I knew which direction the tent should face - just saying
review.name: It fits but ...

review.reviewBody: I like how this  covers the vestibule area along with the underside of the tent although its not really needed.  The only thing I don't like about this is that it does not clip into the tent itself.  My past tent had color coded straps that helped situate the footprint to the tent and had a hole that the tent pole would go through as well after it went through the tents mounting straps.  I have not used the tent or footprint yet so I will have to update when I do but the footprint does feel well built when i opened it up and added the nix wax solarproof &;waterproofing spray to it.
review.name: Should get the job done

review.reviewBody: Yes, it is a decent footprint.  What I don't like is that it completely separate from the main tent.  No grommets to put the pole ends into, doesn't snap to or connect in any way or fashion.  So, you are absolutely left having to take extra time to layout and stake down the footprint.  I own a couple other brand tents and being able to have the footprint securely attach to the main tent in some fashion makes it easy to setup and use.  I've always thought Eureka tents were designed and made well.  This is definitely not one of those cases.
review.name: Not sure I'd call this a 'Fitted' footprint
comment: Thank you for reaching out. I am sorry for our delay in response and for your concerns with your footprint. This product is designed to have adjustable stake out loops. If your product does not have these, there may be an issue with the one you received. If this has not been resolved, please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday as we want you to enjoy your purchase.

review.reviewBody: I like that the footprint has the exact shape of the tent and the vestibules.  It is made of what appears to be the same material as my Timberline 6 which has done a great job of protecting its floor.
review.name: Great shape

review.reviewBody: I never had a footprint that also covered the vestibule so that was a big plus during some hard rain I was in.
review.name: Covers vestibule

review.reviewBody: I love the look of this, and good numerous compliments, which is always nice. However, the functionality is a little less practical. Not super wind or water proof. Not super warm. However, for a shoulder season piece in decent weather, this should fit the bill. I won't be able to use it every time out for these reasons, but I'll bring it along anytime there may be light wind or sprinkles. I'd recommend it still for the looks alone!
review.name: Great Pullover for casual use

review.reviewBody: No sure what else to say, its a shell. Comfortable for a late season Mt. Whitney summit but not in love with it.
review.name: It works as a shell

review.reviewBody: I've had this hoodie for about half a year. It's a great pullover for mild - semi cold weather. It's light and packable. The pockets are very useful. The zipper pouch in the middle can fit a plastic water bottle, keys, and has room for a little more.
review.name: Light and packable hoodie. Love the pockets!

review.reviewBody:
A great light jacket to have during spring/summer when you're not quite sure what the weather has in mind. 

Water resistant enough to protect from light rain, windproof enough to give you that option as well, warm enough for summer evenings or cooler days as well.  

Very light weight and easy to pack or even hang off a day pack or sling bag.  Functional pockets.

Down side for me:  I was slightly disappointed as I was expecting something a little heavier for cooler weather, but it has proven itself to be a great in-between and something I have worn often, likely more than I would if it was heavier.
review.name: Great packable product

review.reviewBody: This is the ultimate do it all article. Wind, water, sun protection that be stored practically anywhere - add in that there zero movement restriction and you have almost no limits with this thing on. If I was rich I'd have one in every color!
review.name: Best OR piece I've ever worn

review.reviewBody: Very light weight and breathable, I took it to Yosemite and actually wicked off water from mist trail. Great one!
review.name: Great day hike jacket

review.reviewBody: the ferossi items are my favorite multi use material, I have 2 jackets, 2 anoraks and the joggers. This weekend I was absolutly impressed with the materials performance saving me up on the mountain. I went to go snowboarding and my big jacket's zipper completly was busted. All I had was the anorak I keep as a spare in my car. I slipped it over the jacket thinking it would get saoked through with the snow falling. For hours of snow falling, May wet snow, it shed the wtness with no problems, I was massivley impressed. I already knew it was an awesome material and very water resistant but this was IMPRESSIVE
review.name: i have put this through the ringer

review.reviewBody: Love the middle zipper pocket and how you can stuff the entire anorak into that pocket then zip it shut. It's very light weight and breathable. The hood scrunchie is a little tighter than I like but it was made that way for a reason and it works well. I'm 190lb 6ft and large is perfect
review.name: Super awesome

review.reviewBody: I wear these to work almost daily, feel and look great! I own 3 of them in different colors.
review.name: The perfect pull over

review.reviewBody: This thing is the bomb. It stuffs down into its own pocket. It's light, it blocks the wind, it can keep some mild precipitation off and it breaths incredibly well. I love mine and you will love yours.
review.name: The best Anorak out there.

name: Ferrosi Anorak Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Strong. Light weight. Adjustable. And they look good! Just what you need poles. I saw a number of reviews saying how hard the baskets are to put on. I ran mine under hot water for maybe 15 seconds each and they popped on no problem.
review.name: Great poles

review.reviewBody: These poles are just what I was looking for. Sturdy construction and light enough for the price point. Plus they look cool which is half the battle in the backcountry!
review.name: Lightweight, Well-made, Look great

review.reviewBody:
I haven't ski'd with these poles yet but I will say there's a lot of reviews stating that the baskets are really hard to put on. They were impossible for me until I found this trick: 
1. Shorten the pole all the way
2. put the tip of the pole through something that the basket doesn't fit through such as two blocks of wood or a chain link fence
3. Turn and push the pole with a lot of weight on it (I had to use my entire body weight, standing on my tipy toes like I was using a bike pump. 
4. POP! they're in!
Hope this helps people :D
- Koii
review.name: Haven't used yet but wanted to share tip after reading other reviews

review.reviewBody: My wife has had a pair for a couple of years and I was envious of the light weight and extended grip. Had to have my own!
review.name: Super light

review.reviewBody: Perfect poles for touring without breaking your budget
review.name: Great quality/value

review.reviewBody: I telemark and I climb (skin) with these poles; shorter on the way down, longer on the way up. Easy to adjust. Weight is not an issue for the touring I do.
review.name: Poles

review.reviewBody: The two plastic discs (whatever they are called) at the bottom of the poles are supposed to twist on and off, but in reality, no matter how tight you twist them on, they come off with literally any movement of the pole. It is impossible to ski with them without those things coming off immediately.
review.name: The two plastic discs (whatever

review.reviewBody: Holding up so far, they seem popular this year I see them everywhere
