review.reviewBody: Everything seemed great till I went to fill the tank, after multiple attempts at multiple locations I took it to a propane supplier and had to have the valve replaced at an extra cost.
review.name: Great kit but the valve was faulty

review.reviewBody:
I went to two places and neither could fill it.  The man at the first place said, before I even try this, Ill tell
You that most of these dont work.
review.name: Cant be filled. Faulty valve assembly.

review.reviewBody: Bought two of these because they fit perfectly in the bed of my truck with the tonneau cover closed. Went to two different filling stations and neither could successfully fill either tank. Too much hassle so these are going back.
review.name: Tried and failed twice to fill these

review.reviewBody: This tank really is just the right size to take around with you; big enough to not have to worry about running out of propane, but small enough to easily lug it around to the campsite.  And the carrying case makes it easy to carry.  Just a well thought out product.
review.name: Size is the Goldilocks of propane tanks

review.reviewBody:
This is a dream come true! The tank is very manageable and holds the equivalent if 5 green propane bottles. It only cost me $4.52 cents to fill it! Less than the cost of one green propane bottle that cost me $5.99
I love the carry case with the webbing so you can secure it in place. Best is you can refill the tank unlike the green propane bottles that arent refillable. Our local town recycle center charges a $2.00 disposal fee for the green propane bottles. 
The hose attachment fit perfectly on my jet boil base camp stove. If you add the green bottle disposal fee to the price of one green bottle thats $7.99. Even though the initial cost of the gas growler is pricey, it will pay for itself in no time. I actually prefer these over the 20 pound tanks which are so cumbersome and heavy. 
I bought a second Ignik deluxe gas growler because I was so impressed.
This tank is too heavy for backpackers but if your going to campgrounds, its perfect.
review.name: Ignik Deluxe Gas Growler

review.reviewBody:
These have been very solid wheels for me. I have been using them as my beater wheels for years. I'm not sure exactly how may miles I have on them, but I have almost worn the brake track past the wear indicator mark, so probably at least 6,000. The set I have now was within 0.3 MM of true when I got them, and they haven't budged since--I've never trued these wheels once. I think the offset rear rim really helps.

I had the prior 10 speed version of these wheels, which did go slightly out of true one me after a lot of off-road miles on 25mm tires. You definitely need to know what you're doing to true these, as the spoke tension is very high, and even small adjustments in tension can move the wheel a long way. 

They aren't exactly light, but they are nice and wide, and are relatively deep for their class. I wouldn't say they are aero, but the low spoke count and bladed spokes help. I've had these on plenty of rides where everyone else was running  aero wheels, and been just fine.

I've run them with clinchers and tubeless; no issues either way. Nice that they come with value stems (and spoke wrenches). 

At the sale price, nothing can touch them. At full price, personally I might probably spend a little more and get something lighter, like aluminum Hunts or HED Ardennes.
review.name: Sloid Wheels

review.reviewBody: Bought these about a year ago for a build and use them on my steel road bike. I am between 175-185 depending on the time of year and this isn't my daily rider. In under a year and just about 1k miles on them I am on my second time needing trued. The first time was minor and then about 2 months after that I just had to do a much more significant truing to the rear wheel.
review.name: Rear wheel constantly needs truing.

review.reviewBody:
I replaced the Bontrager Race stockers that came on my 2016 Trek Domane 5.2 with these in Oct. 2020.  At that time they were just under $300, so I thought they were an outstanding value.  But after over a year of use I no longer feel that's the case.  While the initial build quality was good, the rear wheel constantly needs truing.  At 185 lbs., I'm well under the suggested weight limit of 225, but am unable to maintain the proper spoke tension.  And unlike others here, I've found the ride quality to be somewhat harsh.

I've always found Ultegra components offered near Dura Ace performance for a much lower price, but even though these wheels are pretty light, they seem more Tiagra-level in terms of performance and quality.   They seem like the stock wheels you'd find on an $800-$1,000 bike, even if they weigh much less than wheels typically found on bikes in that price range.  For that reason, and the fact they now cost considerably more than what I paid, I would recommend anyone considering spending $450 on these as a replacement or upgrade instead look at well taken care of used wheelsets with a good reputation.
review.name: Not Ultegra level of quality

name: Ultegra WH-RS500 Road Wheelset - Tubeless

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently purchased both the Savu 2 and the Savu 5 waist packs (the 2 for my wife and the 5 for me).

We are long-time recreational mountain bike/trail riders and desired waist packs to carry our water bottles, a few snacks, small first aid goods, tire levers, tire patch kit, a small multi tool, cell phones, and a small electric tire pump with a bit of room to spare.

I did a lot of internet searching looking at reviews of waist packs and decided on Osprey. I found that these two products are very well made and offered at a very fair and reasonable price.

Both packs are easy to wear and I like the detailed construction of the sides and back of the pack that vents sweat and heat from the body, especially in the hot Arkansas summers where we live and ride (yes, these packs work well).


And during the winter months on the days when it is too cold to ride our bikes, we will wear them on our day hikes as well. :-)
review.name: I recently purchased both the

review.reviewBody: The Savu 2 is a great pack for biking and hiking because it is unobtrusive and carries just the essentials without bogging you down. It was my daily driver on a 5 day gravel bike trip through the Dolomites and stayed in place without fail on some big and fast descents with rough and loose terrain.
review.name: Excellent small pack for those who want to carry an extra bottle

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've been using the Seral 7 for over 3 years and loving it but wanted to try out a bottle only set up. It has been an incredible change. Not needing to fill and empty a bladder for each ride is just one more obstacle to drop to help me get out on the trial. I even plan to buy the Savu 5 to add a 2nd extra bottle for slightly longer or hotter rides. I was particularly happy that I could still fit a small Lezyne hand pump going between both chambers of the Savu 2. It has almost all of the storage I could ask for with a hip pack, small front strap pouches big enough to hold a multitool on one side and an energy bar on the other would make this pack perfect.
review.name: I've been using the Seral

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So far, this is the best hip pack I have found. My only complaint is that it is a little tougher than anticipated to remove/replace the water bottle while riding.
review.name: So far, this is the

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good for small hand pump, snacks, spare tube. holds water bottle snug. hip location allows for great freedom while riding single track. Comfortable trap. This is my daily all-around pack!
review.name: Good for small hand pump,

review.reviewBody: I wear my Savu 2 on my everyday dawn patrol bike rides. It carries my essentials cleanly, comfortably, and securely.
review.name: Love my Savu 2

review.reviewBody: Such a good pack. Comparable to the bontrager rapid pack, but more rigid. This lets you one hand and take the bottle out drink and return it while pedaling easy road and single track. Can carry a decent amount of water with a bottle on the frame and you can carry a larger bottle such as the soma further bottle in the hip pack giving an extra 1 L there. Getting items in can be a bit awkward and space limited but I can fit a tube and some repair items in it plus some first aid kit. Then keep pump and one up edc on the bike. Good pack to help get my rides in the 15 to 20 mile range on my local AZ trails.
review.name: My perfect hip pack

review.reviewBody: I wanted something to carry water, snacks, and tools on medium length bike rides (to replace using a hydration backpack). The SAVU 2 design seemed to be what I needed, but the waist belt wouldn't remain tight. The belt loosens because the plastic cinch buckles allow it to slip. I had to stop every few minutes to cinch the belt tight again. It became a danger on the bike as the loosened belt allowed the pack to get hooked on my saddle. I may hike with it, but I definitely won't use it cycling.
review.name: SAVU 2 Fails Due to Waist Belt Design

review.reviewBody: Love it for short rides where I might need a tool, a tire plug, a gel or two, and just one more bottle: maybe 10 miles. Super comfortable, doesnt jostle around. Do not recommend for longer rides2L is not a lot of storage. So if youre thinking epic, get something bigger.
review.name: Perfect for short rides

name: Savu 2L Hydration Pack

description: Buy the Mammut Crag Dry Duodess Rope - 9.5mm online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Crag Dry Duodess Rope - 9.5mm
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Crag Dry Duodess Rope - 9.5mm online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Have been very happy with the Mammut 9.5 crag ropes. This dry rope gives me confidence to climb even when the weather starts looking rainy.
review.name: Great rope at a great price

review.reviewBody: My favorite dry rope to date. Not as stiff as other dry ropes I have used/purchased in the past which I think is a positive. Its easy to work with and manage. It is also nice to coil at the end of the day. Thanks Mammut!
review.name: Mammut 9.5 Crag Dry Rope

review.reviewBody: Good "hand" feel for a dry rope. Supple handling but highly durable sheath even when climbing on monzonite. Duodess is a key feature that most don't value until they climb on duodess exclusively and then find they can't buy another cord without it.
review.name: Mammut quality continues

review.reviewBody: I used this rope many times this year and it worked amazingly, weighs about as much as youd expect, dry treatment worked well, runs through belay devices well, overall just have had an amazing experience with it so far.
review.name: Great sport climbing rope

review.reviewBody: Ive used this a few times outdoor climbing in some pretty chosy areas around Oregon and its great! I love how dynamic it is and I really dont have any complaints! The rope stretch felt great on a couple large falls on lead. Perfect rope for any level climber!
review.name: Great all around rope

review.reviewBody: This is my fourth Mammut rope. It's been great so far. It's pretty similar to the other Mammut ropes I've owned, which is good. I really like the bi-pattern, it makes it much faster to find the middle than the standard middle marks most ropes have. As the rope gets older I don't need to worry about the middle mark fading. The rope feels nice while belaying and feeds through my different devices well. The dry treatment is nice as well.
review.name: Great rope

review.reviewBody: Durable rope, love the double pattern for finding the middle

Super nice rope. Flows smoothly through all of the various belay devices I have tried (Grigri, ATC Guide, Smart 2.0). Love the dry treatment to keep the rope from getting wet and dirty. 

My only regrets with the rope:
- Bought the 70 m and it is definitely heavier than a 60 m. Haven't found any benefit to the additional length so far.
- The middle mark is not super distinct and prone to wearing off. If I bought another rope, it would be differentially braided between the two halves to make the middle point much more obvious.

Solid rope. Feeds well and has held up well with consistent climbing over the past year. I get compliments on its quality and its color frequently. Only thing that I would love to see added on this rope in the future is a bi-pattern.
review.name: Great role

review.reviewBody: Love this rope, awesome color (others at the crag are envious). It does its job well, no complaints. Climbing rope.
review.name: Awesome rope

name: Crag Dry Duodess Rope - 9.5mm

review.reviewBody: Aprs 18 mois, ne charge plus. J'ai reu en cadeau, je suis trs du, j'ai vrifi le prix, a ne vaut pas le cot. Triste pour ceux qui me l'ont offert. J'ai tout essay; usb, soleil. Rien  faire After 18 months, no longer charges. I received as a gift, I'm very disappointed, I checked the price, it's not worth the cost. Sad for those who gave it to me. I tried everything; usb, sun. Nothing to do
review.name: Ne charge plus
comment: Thanks for your feedback. We're sorry to hear that your panel isn't functioning as expected. We'd like to connect with you and assist in troubleshooting the issue. Please send our team a message here: https://www.bioliteenergy.com/pages/contact

review.reviewBody:
In having read a few reviews I can see this is a common problem
I am not able to charge either a biolite 80 charge pack nor my iphone 15 pro - immediate problem occurring right out of the box. I see from other reviews that overheating is an issue - but if i cannot charge on very sunny days due to overheating, and cannot charge on low light days due to lack of light, this does not seem to be a very useful idea. Yes, I did ensure I pushed the battery button once in order to charge devices, so that was not the issue.
review.name: not functioning out of the box
comment: Thanks for the feedback. We'd like learn more about your experience. Please reach out to our support team at support@bioliteenergy.com.

review.reviewBody: This is a really nice made solar panel I put it outside when I got it worked perfectly nice compact but I think I will buy the bigger one soon or another one like this for my wife.
review.name: New solar panel

review.reviewBody: Purchased and exchanged this panel at least 3 times including Biolite replacing it once.  The panel with a built in battery in theory is a good idea but terrible in that the moment the panel gets warm that the system shuts down and stops producing power (denoted by the 1,2,4,3 light sequence that biolite documentation doesn't even mention.  The panel isn't even warm and yet the panel shuts down.  Biolite, you market yourselves as a premium product company and charge as such but your products fail to deliver.  I've invested $100's into Biolite products and frankly I'm not impressed with ANY of them and will be sending more than 50% of my Biolite products straight to the dump b/c they're beyond 1 year now and even if they're replaced I know what to expect from the replacements.
review.name: Awful product that repeatedly fails
comment: Thank you for leaving us a review. We are always working to improve our product performance and reliability and would appreciate the chance to learn more about your experience across products. Could you please reach out to us at support@bioliteenergy.com? A member of our support team would love to set up a call with you.

review.reviewBody: I have experienced overheating protection in very sunny days so I was unable to both charge mi iPhone 14 Pro Max and the batter from the solar panel unit. However, If you charge it with the micro usb, there is no overheating problems and unit charged without no problems.
review.name: Great idea. Needs improvement.
comment: Hey there! Thanks so much for sharing your thoughts. We're sad to hear that you're experiencing trouble with your Solar Panel 10+. We'd really love to connect with you and lend a hand in troubleshooting this issue. Please reach out to our support team here - https://www.bioliteenergy.com/pages/contact.

review.reviewBody:
Extremely happy with the ease of use, quality of materials and features. My only comment would be to change the cables to USB-C for everything seeing as even Apple is finally converting to the standard.
I use it for travel, camping at our recreational sites here that are off grid and it saves running to the car to charge our lights.
review.name: This has so many uses.

review.reviewBody: Less than a month out of warranty, this started overheating and not charging my devices on a backpacking trip. Was wonderful until then, just not dependable a year later.
review.name: Great until it stops working
comment: Thank you so much for sharing your experience. We're really sorry to hear that your panel isn't working properly. Please don't hesitate to reach out to us here: https://www.bioliteenergy.com/pages/contact   we'd be more than happy to assist you in troubleshooting the issue or exploring a warranty claim.

review.reviewBody: Lasted roughly two weeks. While doing a long portage on the northern forest canoe trail, I set the solar panel on top of my gear to charge my battery pack while I walked. Checked it about an hour later and the lights were flashing indicating it had over heated. Packed it away out of the sun with the rest of my gear. When I checked it later that night it would not power up or show and charge in the pack. The next day when the sun came up I tried to charge my battery pack but as soon as the panel saw sunlight the lights would flash again signaling it was overheated. Tossed it in the dumpster.
review.name: Look elsewhere
comment: Hey there, we're really sorry to hear about your experience with the Solar Panel 10+. We'd love for you to get in touch with us so that we can help you out with troubleshooting or even getting a replacement panel. Please reach out to us here - https://www.bioliteenergy.com/pages/contact

review.reviewBody: I got the Solar 10+ for my birthday and couldnt wait to get it camping. I used it to recharge the battery on my BioLite Fire pit during the day. Charged the battery with no problem along with my cell phone too. Its an awesome addition to my camping gear.
review.name: Awesome to have

review.reviewBody: Worked well.  Charged my phone while it was charging it's own battery.  Can't wait to take this out camping.
review.name: Great backup power.

name: SolarPanel 10+

review.reviewBody: I've ordered many Hokas in my time. I currently have about six pair including hiking boots. Had to send these back because they felt uncomfortable in my right shoe. Bought the skyward X and I love them $55 more money though.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: I have used these as my work shoe for years! I work in medicine and an sometimes in procedures for hours wearing a heavy lead apron, and foot and knee pain is almost exclusively a things of the past! Try them for yourself!
review.name: Tried and True my work shoe!

review.reviewBody: A little too narrow on the sides at the arch and presses inward while walking. I like the style as it is similar shape as the Gaviota 5 that fits right, so I went with another pair in all black.
review.name: Narrow width for a true 13D

review.reviewBody: My running times have gotten faster, my feet are comfortable, and the quality of the sneaker has actually improved. Glad I bought them.
review.name: I love running in these

review.reviewBody: The most comfortable and supportive show for walking.
review.name: I love my HOKAs

review.reviewBody: Not as comfortable as the Gaviota or Challenger. They seem to tight even though I bought the wides .
review.name: Not as comfy

review.reviewBody: I purchased a pair of shoes on 6/24/2024. Warranty issue with the shoe material ripping away from the sole. Website is very slow and hard to navigate.
review.name: Warranty issues

review.reviewBody: After ordering my first pair in women's, I couldn't find any additional colors in my side. So, I went to the men's department and found exactly what I wanted. I love the color choices and have found the Bondi 8 in either men's or women's to be extremely comfortable with a wide toe box. My niece, a busy mom and RN, also wears and loves her Bondi 8. She is on her feet a great deal and thoroughly enjoys her shoes as much as I do!!
review.name: Bondi 8

review.reviewBody: Shoe is a "large" in the toe box, , it is a D width, I ordered a regular, not real happy so far with the shoes, time will tell. I called and was told the shoe only comes in 2 sizes in the toe box D and a large. Is this true?
review.name: Maybe

review.reviewBody: I wear an orthotic and need a combination of a stable foot bed and cushioning for my forefoot. Bondi has been a life saver for me and I've been wearing it for several years. The Bondi 8 felt good initially but after two weeks my feet were hurting and I started getting foot craps at night. I don't think it's as supportive as it was. A few reviews on the internet mentioned that Bondi 8 was a softer shoe than the 7. I returned it and ordered a Bondi 7 instead. With great respect, Hoka, if you have made changes to Bondi, please change it back.
review.name: Returned it for Bondi 7

name: Bondi 8 Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Amazing looking boot and sturdiness but the opening was too narrow for my wife! Not even with help of a shoe horn helped! Returned it!
review.name: Too Narrow

review.itemreviewed: Terradora II Wintry Waterproof Pull-On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought a 6 and 6.5, normally a 6 but thought 6.5 would be good with insoles like my other keen boots. When I tried the 6.5, it was too narrow so I thought the 6 would be a no-go for sure. Tried on the 6 and it was perfect, its more snug than my other keens but its doable and will most likely stretch out.
review.name: A bit narrow but true to size

review.itemreviewed: Terradora II Wintry Waterproof Pull-On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
1. very hard to put on.
2. no cushion on the bottom.
3. couldn't handle 56 degree California rainy weather. Feet wet and cold during a 10 hour shift.
review.name: California

review.itemreviewed: Terradora II Wintry Waterproof Pull-On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The boot does look good but hard to pull on the foot.My daughter wears a half size bigger so she is wearing them .My daughter is trying to make it easier for me to slide them on.I wear a 7 1/2 and my daughter wears a size 8
review.name: Looks good

review.itemreviewed: Terradora II Wintry Waterproof Pull-On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The opening was too narrow to get my foot through without a struggle.
review.name: Returned

review.itemreviewed: Terradora II Wintry Waterproof Pull-On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: After sizing up a half size from my usual Keen 8.5, I was so disappointed that even a 9 was too short. Unlike other reviewers, I was able to easily slip my foot into the boot. However, my toes touched the end and my foot cramped. The quality and construction seemed great, and I am still looking for a slip on waterproof boot that will fit. Unfortunately, size 9.5 was sold out by the time my order arrived.
review.name: Definitely Runs SMALL

review.itemreviewed: Terradora II Wintry Waterproof Pull-On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The boot was the right size, but nearly impossible to pull on. I ordered two different sizes, got the 9.5 on, but decided it was too short. I gave up trying to pull the size 10 on.
review.name: Too tight to pull on foot

review.itemreviewed: Terradora II Wintry Waterproof Pull-On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I even tried a long shoe horn. The ankle of the boot is so tight, I was unable to get my feet in the boots. I took my socks off and shoved with all my might and finally got one foot in and then I had to struggle to get it off. I will say, once my foot was in the boot, it felt comfy. This is a slip on boot and I expect to be able to slip it on even with socks on! I will be returning the product
review.name: Unable to get my foot in the boot

review.itemreviewed: Terradora II Wintry Waterproof Pull-On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The boot is a pandora's box. There's no way to get your foot inside of it. Cute look; just needs a zipper. I couldn't tell you if it runs true to size because I couldn't get my foot in it.
review.name: Whoever designed the boot should be fired

review.itemreviewed: Terradora II Wintry Waterproof Pull-On Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Only got to try them once so far, in low snow, but despite all the warnings of them being impossible to get on due to narrow ankles that don't stretch enough, I was able to get these boots on and off, they are a decently comfortable fit and have good tread. I have a high arch but regular to slim feet that are frequently uncomfortable in shoes that don't accommodate a high arch. I wear 8-8 1/2, got the 9 in these.
review.name: snowboots

name: Terradora II Wintry Waterproof Pull-On Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Shimano Di2 Inline Wireless Unit - EW-WU111 online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Di2 Inline Wireless Unit - EW-WU111
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano Di2 Inline Wireless Unit - EW-WU111 online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I decided I would update the firmware as recommended before a ride, and now I just dropped the bike off at a shop because the entire system is bricked. No power, no lights, no shifting, really wish I wouldve gone with ETAP
review.name: Killed my system

review.reviewBody: My older DI2 battery didnt support the wireless unit so when it came time for an upgrade, I added the  EW-WU111 and a short cable.  Installation was simple and configuring my Garmin Edge to recognize the wireless unit was straightforward.  Nice to have battery status onscreen and nerds will like knowing their gear ratios.
review.name: Nice upgrade for an older DI2 System

review.reviewBody: I bought this with trepidation because of the other reviews but had no real issues. Yes, Make sure to update everything before you start Then choose it at a sensor on your wahoo or whatever and you'll be able to see your gears, know how much charge you have left and switch screens with the buttons on top of your hoods. Worth $70? Your call.
review.name: No problems for me

review.reviewBody: I'll start by saying I've had some of the same frustrations as other reviewers, but I've found some tips to help make things go well. First, ensure your phone is charged and that no further updates to it will happen while using the E-Tube software. Next, ensure that the software is up to date before any firmware updates. And lastly, don't be in a rush, be patient while using the software. Sometimes it can take a while and appear to stop working when it is actually thinking in the background. If you take that care you should be good. FWIW I am using an Android phone and that may help (everything Apple seems to think it is smarter than everything else and tries to control the situation and tends to muck things up). All this said and done, the hardware works and can make updating firmware on your drivetrain pretty easy.
review.name: Handy Tool

review.reviewBody:
Physically installing this unit took all of 3 min (and another Shimano cable not included).  Getting the unit connected to the Shimano E-Tube app took 2 hours, multiple devices, and a lot of swearing.  Connected to my iPhone on first try but would not run firmware update.  Installed E-Tube app on PC and updated firmware.  Once updated, unit would not connect to iPhone no matter what I did.  Ultimately ran through several additional Apple devices before my daughters iPad finally connected and finished setup.  It was mind numbing and I nearly gave up.  The unit now works great.  I really like seeing gears on my Wahoo screen and controlling the pages/zoom.  

Knocked stars off for terrible setup but once setup completed, this works as advertised.
review.name: Prepare for brain damage

review.reviewBody: The Bluetooth connection was interrupted during a update, and now it's completely dead.
review.name: Defective

review.reviewBody:
The problem with this unit is that if anything goes wrong while you're using it, it can lock up your system to the point that you can't shift and you can't recover without the help of a bike shop - at least officially. Unofficially, there's a messy hack you can do (but I won't go into that). 

My experience was that my IPhone went into power-save mode - as it often does - during a firmware update, and it totally locked everything up.  

My recommendation is to download the e-tube software to your PC, and do all of your updates and customizations that way. There's much less chance of a disconnect, and it's much safer.
review.name: Risky to use

name: Di2 Inline Wireless Unit - EW-WU111

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really wanted to love this coat, but I was in between sizes and unhappy with both the medium and the large. I would describe this coats silhouette as mostly straight up and down, so if youre athletic/curvy like me, then you might experience some unflattering pulling at the hips. I tried sizing up one to a size large to try to remedy this because I liked the design and color so much, but I ended up looking very wide. Unfortunately didnt work out for me.

comment:
Hello there

Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention. I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. Were available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: long sleeve, fit well, good quality, good size, i like it
review.name: Women's Prospect winter Coat black size lx long

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought a size above my normal winter coat preference. I love this coat!! Im 52 and a size XL hits about mid-calf. Winter is winding down in the northeast, but I wore it today for some predicted winter weather. I was super cozy - felt like I was wearing a nice fluffy down blanket. I love the chest level pocket placement. Highly recommend for anyone that has to spend time out in the weather!
review.name: Womens Prospect Coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat surpasses my expectations. Its ultra warm and comfy. As other reviewers have noted, the placement of the pockets is a bit odd  theyre too high. It works OK for me, but may not for taller people.
review.name: Warm coat!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I just received this coat and I would love to keep it for the following reasons: color (purple fig) is a rich color that doesn't show stains much and isn't the usual black or blue. Cut even in XL is flattering, not like so many others that look like you slipped into a sleeping bag. Quality is great and the additional side zippers are so handy for car rides for extra room (also it has the double front zip). The hood is detachable and is comfy open and closed and the additional flap shields from cold winds. I love all that!
Big But though: the pockets. Feel bit like Napoleon. In XL they sit so high, my shoulders actually are raised a bit, it isn't relaxing or practical. Zipping up is really awkward and leaving them unzipped makes the chest part look even bigger, especially looking at it from side.
I so hope they drop the pockets down next winter and I'll be the first to buy it, even full price!
It is a bit snug in the shoulders on me due to the feminine cut, so offering a XXL would be advised in my opinion (I am 5'6" and 193 lbs).
review.name: Lovely coat with side zips... pockets too high!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased the black in an XS based on guidelines.  It fit fine but I wanted it a bit bigger.  The black was sold out in a small.  I very hesitantly went with this color instead and WOW am I glad I did.  The color online doesn't do it justice.  Think of a pond filled with sun-bleached lily pads. The prettiest shade of green!  So many compliments and a great way to add some color to the dreary, cold, NY winter dog walks!  It is lightweight, squishable, and WARM.  The inside sleeve liner is snug around the wrists, would love to see thumbholes there. Hood isn't too large.  Inside zipper pocket is an added bonus.  I am 5"3", 110, the outside pockets are deep and placed a bit above hip height , but I like it better.  Overall 5 stars.
review.name: CLICK NOW!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this coat.  The fit is true to my usual size.  Other reviewers did not like the placement of the coat's pockets.  I find them to be just fine and, the pockets are very large.  I especially love the length of this coat.  It goes well below my knees, keeping my legs  out of the wind and cold.  The jacket's sleeves are lined very well and keep out the cold.  I live in Wisconsin and it gets cold here in winter.  This coat is constructed to keep me warm and in style.  Added bonus, got it on sale for 60% off!!!
review.name: Love the Prospect coat

name: Prospect Coat - Women's

review.reviewBody: Love these. Very thin but warm for mild winter. Got them to wear under my ski gloves but I wear them as my everyday gloves now. Not the softest wool but it's not the itchy kind either. If you own any Smartwool products, expect the same wool as the socks and longjohns.
review.name: Perfect lining gloves

review.reviewBody: My previous pair I shredded doing rock scrambling, So I am hoping this pair holds up a little better, these are nice and thin and perfect for a light glove that still fits inside ski Gloves. I have used these several times working and building on an outdoor rink in Montana. Where gloves are constantly coming on and off and liners are needed to do fine motor skills as well as extra warmth on the colder nights.  These thus far have been very good and keep my hands warm.
review.name: Soft and light, just want i needed

review.reviewBody: My feet are on the wide side and these are very comfortable. I use them with my Schwinn IC4 spinning bike. I wear a 9-9.5 and ordered a 42, and would have been fine with a 41. The sizing chart on these shoes is very confusing! The velcro closure makes them comfortable and adjustable, and the upper is nice and soft.

review.reviewBody: To be honest, I was hesitant to try these...any shop that carries them has a different conversion chart and I heard rumors that the brand ran narrow and small. Thankfully, neither of those rumors are true. I ordered my normal size 8 (39) and these fit perfectly! Super easy to clip in to my echelon ex5, and super cute to boot (I ordered the white/fog)! (Not that anyone can see me ?????). Also love that BC price matches!! I?ve never been disappointed by a purchase.
review.name: These are exactly what I was hoping for

review.reviewBody: I bought this shoe in my normal size.  It runs short and they are not comfortable.  Would not recommend purchasing this shoe.
review.name: Not happy

description: Buy the Altra Torin 5 Leather Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Torin 5 Leather Shoe - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Altra Torin 5 Leather Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These are true to size,  love the shoes, They are very comfortable and I have already decided I will buy another pair when these wear out.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: I am so happy to finally find a pair of wide toe box, zero drop shoes that fit my extraordinarily wide, bunioned, feet. In the past all I could wear is ASICSs EEEE, which are comfortable, but taper at the toe. I can wear toe socks and toe correctors inside and my feet feel good. Thank you!
review.name: I am so happy!

review.reviewBody: This my first order from this store and my first time using Altra running torin 5 shoes and am very happy with this shoes its amazing product ever I had. The product delivered within the same time to my front door intact. Thank you for your service.
review.name: The best product and experience

review.reviewBody: On my third day wearing these to work at my rest stop plaza job, they started making a sound like I walked on a wet floor. This sound happened even on my concrete driveway..
review.name: I would not recommend this to a friend..

review.reviewBody: I was recommended Altra by a friend who is a long time customer of yours. I bought Torin 5 Leather, she bought Via Olympus and we started wearing them on the same day. It soon became apparent that my pair was wearing much faster, even though we were walking the around the same distance. Now her pair still looks good, but the sole on mine has worn thru to the fabric. The toe area of the sole also wore badly and stopped being waterproof. In fact it acted more like a sponge so, even when the ground was only damp, moisture would seep thru to the foot. It's a real pity because when I first put them on it was like walking on air and I almost ordered a second pair right away! I was going to chalk it up to bad luck but now I see there are lots of similar reviews about wear on this particular model. Seems like a design or manufacturing flaw for this style shoe letting down an otherwise well regarded company.
review.name: Sole Soul Destroying

review.reviewBody: Altra used to be good but lately the poor quality craftsmanship and bad quality have taken them down. They have also gone off the rails with repulsive color combinations. Shoes fall apart after several months, whereas my pair from 3 years ago still going strong.
review.name: Unfortunate

review.reviewBody: On my 3rd day wearing them to work, the left shoe began making an annoying sucking/squeaking sound. I don't like wearing them now which is a shame for a rather expensive shoe..
review.name: I am disappointed unfortunately..

review.reviewBody: Love Altra's. Perfect shoe for work, running or days off. Please continue/adding neutral color options!!! The leather has held up well, I'm a firefighter and these have lasted over a year of extreme abuse. People run into issues because they are overweight or drag their feet. If I can run medical/fire calls off of a fire engine for a year I think they pass quality control for me. Thanks!
review.name: Please don't discontinue, please continue neutral colors!

review.reviewBody: It looked like a nice shoe and had to return but as an 80 yr old, I messed up on the return. Was dropped off with bottom part of packing slip at UPS on 6/6/24 at ~11:30 HST. Called to see if you rec'd on 6/26/24 but was told it has not yet and to call back on 7/12 to check. So will do next week. Original order# 28175341 ordered on 5/31/24.
review.name: Wrong size

review.reviewBody: I needed a wide toe box for a compressed nerve in my foot. My orthopedic Dr recommend these shoes. I paid the high price and got them. They were great at first but the sole started shredding underneath within 3 months! I fell leaving work badly injuring myself because of the pieces coming apart underneath! Chunks are coming off the bottom of the sole! Altria you'll be hearing from my attorney! I will now have to miss work because of these injuries.
review.name: These are dangerous!

name: Torin 5 Leather Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Astral Green Jacket Limited Edition PFD online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Green Jacket Limited Edition PFD
hasVariant.description: Buy the Astral Green Jacket Limited Edition PFD online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Fantastic, Comfortable, beautiful design. This is the coolest lifejacket ever made. It fits perfectly it floats high. It keeps you safe and it looks awesome.
review.name: Amazing, lifejacket, fantastic details, and design

review.reviewBody:
This is my third GreenJacket, second LE version. First was a hand-me-down from my husband, which I wore for one season to figure out if it was the right fit and function for me as a woman and a rafter, not a kayaker. I'd previously had an Astral Sea Wolf, but I needed to upgrade to a Type V vest for bigger water and rescue scenarios. 

First new-to-me GreenJacket was the LE11, which I purchased prior to joining my local mountain rescue team in 2019. I'm small chested (34B bra size), so I didn't need a women's specific vest. I've rowed hundreds of miles, paddle guided, swam rapids and rigged ropes in the LE11, and it's the most comfortable and capable PFD I've owned.

I was stoked that the release of the LE15 coincided with needing a new PFD because the graphics are killer. I haven't taken it on the water yet since we are heading into winter here, but the fit is the same as my previous GreenJackets, cozy like a hug, awesome range of motion and supportive enough that I don't have to wear a bra if I'm not feeling it. 

The knife attachment on the front of the clamshell is still in a terrible spot for rafters, as it gets caught in the perimeter line of my raft when I'm trying to pull myself out of the water and into the boat, so I wear my knife on one of the side straps. Not ideal, but I've yet to find a better spot for it that isn't in the way. 

Happy with my purchase so far, looking forward to testing it out next spring.
review.name: Stoked to be part of the wolfpack

name: Green Jacket Limited Edition PFD

review.reviewBody: Love these pants. They are very lightweight, cool and comfortable for summer. They move with you. And I like the side pockets that fit my phone and wallet.
review.name: Perfect Fit

review.reviewBody: I do not climb at all but I took a chance with these pants and Im so glad I did. I have had these exact pants in two different colors for over a year now and I love them. They are the perfect pant to wear literally anywhere. You can dress them up or down. They are very thin but the fabric's excellent quality have prevented any tears or rips; I have never put them in my dryer, always hang to dry. Flattering in the rear, you need a thong with these as the rear is pocketless and any sort of panty line is very noticeable. I usually order mediums but I think these run a tad large so small fits me best. I love the drawstring at the ankles, it allows you to change up the look. I am typically not a I have these in every color! type of girl but these pants may turn me into that girl, which makes me cringe comfortably in my pants.
review.name: Fantastic

name: Koen Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
VERY GOOD PRODUCTS , BUT VERY HARD TO DO NEW PRODUCTS
THANK YOU
review.name: NOT ENOUGH NEW PRODUCTS

review.reviewBody: I will agree the fit is a tiny bit off, but the look is fantastic. I bought all three after day one in the blue shirt. The only real complaint Ill have with it is how insanely wrinkled up they get in the wash. Its long iron job to bring it back to life. But, . Big deal.
review.name: Great look

review.reviewBody:
Love the fabric (the faint texture, that you can't really see online, adds some character in a good way) and seems really well sewn. The orange is a great color - looks even better in real life than on the website. 
As another reviewer said, though - the sizing... I'm well aligned with a small in the size chart (and typically am a small in shirts), but it's really really big on me in real life - even through the shoulders. Definitely order a smaller size than you would have thought.
review.name: Great shirt! Sizing though...

review.reviewBody: I am very disappointed with this shirt. The fit is great, but after the first wash (yes, I followed all the instructions) and hung it to dry, it came out very wrinkled, For a 50/50 material blend, I could not believe how wrinkly it is. I was going to take it on my trip to Europe but without regular access to irons, it will have to stay home.
review.name: Very wrinkly after washing

review.reviewBody:
I'm a 46" chest, and wear a XXL Abisko Trail Fleece, so I didn't hesitate to order the XXL in this shirt.  I'm swimming in the shirt.  There's at least 4" of fabric on either side of my chest.  In most other brands, I'll wear a L or XL, it actually seems like these shirts may be large in XL as well.

Other than that, they're pretty fantastic.  Very well made, and I can't wait to get ones that fit!
review.name: Sizing is WAY off.

name: Ovik Lite Short-Sleeve Shirt - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III Conquest Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Ugh obsessed! Honestly every Sorel shoe/boot I buy is incredible! So comfy and surprisingly warmer than I expected! Excellent add to my closet!
review.name: Love these!

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III Conquest Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These shoes are perfect for the Scottish winter months, cosy, comfy, waterproof and easy to slip off when you get home. I have narrow feet and wear them with thick socks and bought half a size up from my normal size.
review.name: Perfect winter walkers

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III Conquest Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Size is a bit too small even though I have ordered my usual size
review.name: Size a bit too small but nice looking shoes

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III Conquest Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes for a trip to NYC in December, temperatures were 25-35 degrees, and we were going to be touristing, walking a lot outdoors, and I just got back from that trip and these shoes are the best! Never were my feet cold, they are super comfortable, we walked/stood for 8+ hours for 5 days, and I have no complaints! They did a Great job!
review.name: Great for a NYC winter trip

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III Conquest Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wore these tailgating on a very cold day and my feet were warm. Also walked over 4 miles in them and they were definitely comfortable. My only suggestion would be going up a half size if you want to where thick socks.
review.name: Comfortable and warm

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III Conquest Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes for a European trip because they were cute and waterproof. After I received them and tried them on, they felt okay. A little narrow, but I thought they might mold to my foot. After wearing them at home to break them in and for a few days walking around various European cities, my feet are killing me. If you have even slightly wide feet or any occasional foot pain, I would not recommend these shoes. They also run a little small, so Id size up a half size.
review.name: Cute, but runs small, narrow, and no cushion or arch support
comment: Hello A Walker, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. Were sorry that our Women's Out N About III Conquest Boot is hard to size. Were happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III Conquest Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great pair of ankle boots, especially at a reduced price.  I already have another pair in a different colour.
review.name: Great ankle boots

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III Conquest Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Ripped after 3 wears! These are very warm and am cute but they ripped after wearing just 3 times.
review.name: So disappointed.
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III Conquest Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great looking shoe/boot. Runner too narrow across little toe area.
review.name: Great look but too narrow
comment: Hello Darlene, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. Were sorry that our Women's Out N About III Conquest Boot is hard to size. Were happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III Conquest Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these boots! First off, they are so comfortable. Some boots are heavy and hard to move around in, but these feel more like shoes with all the great qualities of a good snow boot. They are waterproof and also stylish. So happy with my purchase!
review.name: Stylish and Comfy!

review.reviewBody: I'm not really a review guy but i feel i needed to express my opinion on these bars.  They're awesome!  Just what i was looking for on my Orbea Vibe city bike. Especially if you don't want to replace all the components needed for standard drop bars.

review.reviewBody:
I really like this jersey and the color schemes are fantastic!  With that said, I normally wear XL in most of the Castelli jerseys but had to go 2XL for this model.  I like my jersey to fit snug but not a compression fit.  I am 5'9 and 175 pounds muscular build.

Hope this helps.
review.name: Great Jersey but runs small

review.reviewBody: I am XL in Mavic and Pearl Izumi but 2XXL for this jhersey
review.name: great but runs very small

review.reviewBody: Castelli is almost always pretty true. I took a L, the XL was not much difference. I'm 6'0, 180 lbs. Breathes well. Would re-purchase
review.name: Great Fit, True Sizing

review.reviewBody: its nicely made but it runs small.  If you where a Large buy a XL or XXL
review.name: Runs Small

review.reviewBody:
This item runs really small. Got a medium,it was way small,returned and got a large,the arms were no bigger than the medium.
Seems like a quality item but the sizing is way off.
review.name: J Michael

review.reviewBody: I returned it b/f using.  I am usually between a L and XL depending on brand.  Ordered an XL of this jersey and I couldn't get out of it without another person pulling it off me from the back.
review.name: Jersey runs way too small

review.reviewBody: This Jersey runs too small. It is short at the waist. Does not run on standard size. The material & colors are good.
review.name: This Jersey runs too small.

review.reviewBody: I ordered a single Castelli jersey to assure it fits prior to ordering more.  The first one fit great!  Ordered another in the exact same size and it is too small.  Not sure if location of mfg played in as one was made in China and the other in El Salvador.  Shipping time was great!
review.name: Castelli Jersey
